Class: ResultSetIterator

$.hdb. ResultSetIterator

Represents an iterator over a $.hdb.ResultSet object.

new ResultSetIterator()

Example
var connection = await $.hdb.getConnection();
var result = await connection.executeQuery('SELECT FLAVOR, PRICE, QUANTITY FROM "DB_EXAMPLE"."ICECREAM"');
var iterator = result.getIterator();
var totalPrice = 0;
while(iterator.next()) {
    var currentRow = iterator.value();
    totalPrice += currentRow['PRICE'];
}

Methods

next() → {boolean}

Checks if the underlying $.hdb.ResultSet has more rows and sets the value of the iterator to the next row if it exists.
Returns:
True if the result set has more rows otherwise returns false.
Type
boolean

value() → {object}

Returns the current row that the iterator's value is set to. Should always be called after a call to next();
Throws:
Throws an error if next() was not previously called or if there are no rows in the result set.
Type
$.hdb.SQLException
Returns:
An object representing the row of a $.hdb.ResultSet.
Type
object
